entry.title: [Global][VMware Private Cloud] - vSphere Client login
entry.content:
Jan 31, 15:36 UTC
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Jan 31, 09:49 UTC
Update - Our teams will perform a final patch implementation and deployment to prevent this from happening again. After these operations, we will be able to close the job completely.

Jan 30, 18:05 UTC
Monitoring - Start time : 27/01/2023 13:00 UTC
End time : 30/01/2023 17:11 UTC
Service status: Services are working as they should be.
Ongoing actions : The Pccs Impacted have been fixed.

Jan 30, 14:39 UTC
Update - We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Jan 30, 14:37 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 27/01/2023 13:00 UTC
Service impact : The vSphere Client login page is returning 500 error preventing login to vSphere.
Ongoing actions : Our technical teams are working on the issue. Update will be post as significant progress is made.
Root cause : An incompatible configuration version is being deployed on "SSL gateway" (the machine that acts as a bridge & firewall between your Hosted Private Cloud and the internet and allows you to connect to the vSphere web client among others things).

Dec 19, 02:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Dec 8, 21:14 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 19/12/2022 02:00 UTC 
End time : 31/01/2023 05:00 UTC 
Service impact : None
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our network infrastructure, we will upgrade the version of multiple network equipment.

entry.title: [Global][VMware] - VMware Remote Console
entry.content:
Jan 30, 21:14 UTC
Resolved - Start time : 08/12/2022 09:00 UTC
End Time : 30/01/2023 15:30 UTC
The deployment has been completed.

Jan 25, 14:56 UTC
Update - Our teams are still deploying the solution across all our infrastructures. We estimate that the deployment will be completed on 03/02/2023.
We will keep you informed of any updates.

Jan 16, 03:35 UTC
Update - The solution we were working on is now being deployed progressively on all infrastructures as part of our usual & automatic upgrade process.
In the meantime, you can still use the "Web Console" available in your vSphere Web Client.

As previously indicated, if you previously changed the configuration to use the "legacy connection mode", you'll have to remove the custom configuration on your workstation, refer to the note below for more information.

Jan 6, 18:12 UTC
Update - We'll get back to you as soon as we have more information.

Jan 6, 18:10 UTC
Monitoring - Start time : 08/12/2022 09:00 UTC
User impact : VMware Remote Console (VMRC) in "legacy connection mode" (cf https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/76672) is not working anymore with last Hosted Private Cloud infrastructure upgrades.
Root cause : A configuration change on the "SSL gateway" (the machine that acts as a bridge & firewall between your Hosted Private Cloud and the internet and allows you to connect to the vSphere web client among others things) required to adress the VMSA-2022-0030 pulished in december https://www.vmware.com/security/advisories/VMSA-2022-0030.html
Workaround : We are actively working on a solution to bring back VMRC. In the meantime, you can use the "Web Console" available in your vSphere Web Client.

Note : We will probably not bring back the VMRC "legacy connection mode" (port 902) because it conflicts with the configuration change required to adress the VMSA-2022-0030. Instead, we are currently working on a solution to allow the VMRC "standard connection mode" (port 443). Once deployed, if you previously used the "legacy connection mode" you'll have to remove the custom configuration on your workstation, refer to "Resolution" section of this VMware guide : https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/76672 to find the lines to remove.

entry.title: [EU/CA][VMware Private Cloud] - vCenter and ESXi major upgrade
entry.content:
Jan 30, 07:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jan 24, 18:45 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 30/01/2023 07:00 UTC 
End time : 03/02/2023 17:00 UTC 
Service impact : The management plane will be unavailable for 1 hour during the maintenance schedule.
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy of our infrastructure, we are rolling an upgrade for the VMware vCenter Server Appliance solution.
The operation will be done by pool. A communication will be send to inform customers of their specific schedule.

entry.title: [EU/CA/Secnumcloud][Hosted Private Cloud] - vROps
entry.content:
Jan 30, 07:00 UTC
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Jan 24, 18:15 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 30/01/2023 07:00 UTC 
End time : 03/02/2023 17:00 UTC 
Service impact : vROps unavailable during the upgrade
Service improvement : As part of our continuous improvement policy, we need to upgrade vROps (vRealize Operations) to its last version.
The duration will be one hour per vrom.
Customer can reschedule maintenance.
Customer will be notified by email when the maintenance is scheduled.
